intro: Brackenridgea palustris, commonly known as the marsh brackenridgea, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features showy, yellow flowers that bloom in late summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are large, heart-shaped, and often covered in a fine, hairy texture. Brackenridgea palustris typically grows in wetland habitats, thriving in moist, sandy soils.
